alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph, southeastern Lewis, southern Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Mill Creek, or 12 miles southeast of Buckhannon, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Cave, Holly River State Park, Huttonsville, Alexander, Kanawha Head, Eden, Helvetia, Cleveland, Pickens and Alton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
